Another of the Israeli soldiers killed fighting Hamas terrorists in Gaza yesterday was Adam Bismut, 35.

Adam founded the startup SightBit, that developed a life-saving AI system that locates drowning people at sea and alerts rescuers.

May his memory be blessed! https://t.co/lVbZrsocos

She lost one son, and the other is still fighting in Gaza. This is the outstanding spirit of our people that can never be broken. HYD ZL

One of the fallen IDF soldiers is Ahmed Abu Latif, a Bedouin Muslim IDF soldier.

Ahmed embodied the spirit of unity and patriotism, a shining example of coexistence and unwavering love for Israel. 

Ahmed, your legacy will forever inspire us. https://t.co/2tAT9foVJI

Yoval Lopez, father of 3 from Alon Shevut fell defending our land. Originally from Peru, he was part of the Bnei Moshe-known as Inca Jews-who emigrated en masse  in 1990 after converting to Judaism

The famous convert Rut said "where you die I die"

Sadly we are living her legacy https://t.co/Celvrgoj9u

Sgt. First Class (res.) Ahmad Abu Latif, 26, lost his life yesterday fighting in Gaza. Here's what he said in October on Facebook (shortened):

"Shalom, my name is Ahmad Au Latif, father to little Mansura, 11 months old. 

I am proud to be a Bedouin-Israeli!

For me, the people I live and work with are my brothers and sisters, and we all live together and respect each other in our land. I am proud to be a Bedouin that served in the IDF as a combat soldier. I was blessed to have a meaningful service that I will never forget. During my service I discovered my strength and capabilities, and how I can deal with challenges, and I met amazing people who are friends for life.

I'm happy to be able to connect betweeen cultures. I can invite my friends to have meat and Maqluba in Rahat, and I can come to the garden in the Kibbutz where they play guitar and sing Hebrew songs. I am happiest when I can travel the country with my friends and when I teach them Arabic and they try to speak with me and ask for help.

During the war we have fallen soldiers who are Bedouin, Druze, Muslims abd Christians - they died heroes protecting our country.

I want to awaken everybody reading this: we all share the same fate and we must be united. Unfortunately there are people who don't believe we should be and are trying to scare and break the trust - do not let them."

Baruch Dayan HaEmet

Cedric was born in the Philippines and came to Israel with his mother for work. He was a troubled kid who got caught up in crime, but when he was arrested in front of his mother in Tel Aviv as a teen, he decided he could no longer break her heart. He cleaned up his act and volunteered to serve in the IDF as a combat soldier, even earning a unit citation. Yesterday he lost his life in Gaza, protecting *our* shared country, *our* shared people. A hero. 

May his memory be a blessing. üáÆüá± üáµüá≠

Elkana Vizel, one of the soldiers killed in Gaza last night, wrote a letter to his family in case of the worst. He writes:

If you are reading these words, something must have happened to me. If I was kidnapped, I demand that no deal be made for the release of any terrorist to release me. Our overwhelming victory is more important than anything, so please continue to work with all your might so that the victory is as overwhelming as possible.

Maybe I fell in battle. When a soldier falls in battle it is sad, but I ask you to be happy. Don't be sad when you part with me. Touch hearts, hold each other's hands and strengthen each other. We have so much to be proud and happy about.

We are writing the most significant moments in the history of our nation and the entire world. So please, be happy, be optimistic, keep choosing life all the time. Spread love, light and optimism. Look at your loved ones in the whites of their eyes and remind them that everything we go through in this life is worth it and we have something to live for. 

Don't stop the power of life for a moment I was already wounded in operation Tzuk Eitan, but I do not regret that I returned to fight. This is the best decision I ever made.

Baruch Dayan HaEmet

21 dead IDF soldiers? Why? Because the IDF cares about Gaza civilians so instead of bombing from the air, they sent in soldiers by foot. 

Instead of risking Palestinian life, Israel is risking its own children. 

And yet? The morally deprived world yells genocide. If Israel was committing anything even remotely resembling genocide, there would be zero Israeli casualties. 

Stop believing lies and start using your brain.  

Oh, and by the way, several of the casualties from yesterday are Israeli Arabs. Ya know; just in case you want to throw the apartheid lie out there. 

This is Achmad Abu Latif, an Arab IDF soldier who fell yesterday in Gaza. 

Brains, people. You have them. Use them!
